From: Derek Buchheit 
Sent: Thursday, September 3, 2020 1:24 PM
To: Taylor Moore <Taylor.Moore@chhi.org>
Cc: Matthew Orem <Matthew.Orem@chhi.org>
Subject: RE: [patacct49][patacct54][patacct56][cs11][cs27][cs29][cs88] Payment/Adjustment by Patient Code

On the replacement for Daily Payment and Adjustment Summary we have a few reports published that could fulfill this need. 
•	Adjustment Summary by Alias; or Payment Summary by Alias – These are interactive cubes that can give you total for a single day or month to date based on what you choose for activity date. You can also drill down to see details. 
•	Daily Payment and Adjustment Summary – this is similar to what you use today. I added the subtotals by type that we discussed to the end of the report. 


Samples of both attached. Let me know if we can close this one out. I can certainly give you a call to discuss too.

From: Derek Buchheit <Derek.Buchheit@chhi.org> 
Sent: Wednesday, August 26, 2020 4:28 PM
To: Allman, Timothy <timothy.allman@changehealthcare.com>
Cc: Matthew Orem <Matthew.Orem@chhi.org>; Klinkhardt,David <David.Klinkhardt@cerner.com>; Houdek,Jaime <Jaime.Houdek@Cerner.com>
Subject: RE: (External Email) [patacct106] Uncontrolled Write-Off Report

Thanks for the sample. I made a few revisions based on that. We have similar report offerings in Cerner, it’s just split up into a few different reports. 

We have are other options as well, but for simplicity these are the 3 Cerner reports that matchup the most to that existing report. They are all the Interactive Pivot style where you can drill down to the details. 
•	Adjustment Summary by Alias – has write-off amounts, including bad debt
•	Payment Summary by Alias
•	Claim Balance, Payment and Adjustment Summary – Has the invoice balance amts and payment/adjustments to those claims

Let me know what you think.

It appears Taylor signed-off on "Payments and Adjustments on Bad Debt Encounters" but this is an old pft_ report and there's probably a better one available. If not then the prompts on "Payments and Adjustments on Bad Debt Encounters" need updated.
I believe the prompts only need to be updated on the "A/R Balance Control" report.
Derek to develop DWH Census extract and coordinate with Jason Stadler

CPT - for now we will support CPT on radnet requisitions only. If other solutions such as lab need this, they should incorporate the same OEF preprocessing script oe_default_from_form so that CPT is stored on order_detail.
@mattorem Just adding tag to followup on who is taking ownership of this request.

From: Derek Buchheit 
Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 2020 10:22 AM
To: Mike Cartwright <Mike.Cartwright@chhi.org>; Starr Lowe <Starr.Lowe@chhi.org>
Cc: Matthew Orem <Matthew.Orem@chhi.org>
Subject: [cs47] Coded CPT/HCPCS by Rev Code

Good morning. The below report request is ready for review. The new report is ‘Revenue Summary by Facility and Rev Code’ and is available for review in DiscernReportingPortal here:
https://chhwv.cernerworks.com/Citrix/BuildWeb/

I’ve attached samples. At the prompts, you’ll specify the date range, billing entity, facility, and Rev Codes you are interested in. Then from the summary pivot table view double click any row to drill down and see the details. From this detail view is where you can see the CPT / HCPCS that was assigned to that Rev Code. 

Are there any changes needed for this report?

From: Derek Buchheit 
Sent: Thursday, August 13, 2020 4:15 PM
To: Taylor Moore <Taylor.Moore@chhi.org>
Subject: [cs43] Charges Posted After Service Month

The replacement for ‘Y JWS CHGS POSTED AFTER SERVICE DT’ is also completed. The new report is called ‘Charged Posted outside Service Month’. It should be pretty straightforward. 

Here is a sample if you ran this on July 5th to pick up the June late charges. This should give you an idea of what fields are on the report, but the data itself will be odd as it’s test patient data. 

Will this new report work? It appears Room/Bed and Daily Supply charges do show as they always post the following day. If we find out we don’t want those, we can either just filter them out in Excel or in the report itself.

From: Derek Buchheit 
Sent: Thursday, August 13, 2020 3:58 PM
To: Taylor Moore <Taylor.Moore@chhi.org>
Cc: Houdek,Jaime <Jaime.Houdek@Cerner.com>; 'Klinkhardt,David' <David.Klinkhardt@cerner.com>
Subject: RE: [patacct49][patacct54][patacct56][cs11][cs27][cs29][cs88] Payment/Adjustment by Patient Code

Taylor, I’ve added the totals to the end of the ‘Daily Payment and Adjustment Summary’ report like we discussed. This report can be run for a single day or a range of days – samples attached on what it looks like now. 


Regarding your Affinity totals, here is what I have on the new report:

•	TOTAL ADJ – added to report
•	TOTAL PAY – added to report
•	TOTAL NON-PATIENT A/R – Added to report ‘Non A/R - GL Only Payment’
•	TOTAL PAT XFR – not added to report since no known Cerner equivalent; We can update report later if one is identified.  
•	TOTAL INT – not added to report since no known Cerner equivalent; We can update report later if one is identified.  
•	TOTAL W/O – I added these 4 transaction types. Should they all be under this same Bad Debt subtotal? That’s how I have it for now. 
Bad Debt Adjustment
Bad Debt Recovery
Bad Debt Reversal
Bad Debt Writeoff

Let me know if there is anything else on this one.

What does “held over” mean as  the census event? Held Over = patients in a bed at midnight. So when we pick Yesterday as the activity date, this is the patients here when yesterday closed. 
Why do lots of other non nursing units show with pts? It should only be showing pts for nursing units not ancillary services. Maybe it is doing this bc of the test data? Yes, test data. Someone registered a test patient as inpatient or observation in that unit. 
How do you get to the details display like in your instruction handout? Double click the number next to Cabell Huntington Hospital or the nurse unit. 
How would I run a census per unit to  show the current census by unit with the pt detail? Would it be this report?   I will need this type of info for a surveyor real time. This is the report I’d recommend to see today’s census (patient’s held over in bed at yesterday midnight); or you can even run historic dates. You then double click on the number to see the detail. You can also download to excel from within the detail view. 

For the last question, I also recommend checking out ‘Patient Lists’ within Powerchart to gives a real time view of each nurse unit. It’s a few steps to setup your patient list the first time (instructions attached). The good news is you only have to do that once and the list is saved. The next time it’s a simple as opening Powerchart and selecting Patient Lists. 

Thanks for your help!!!
Denise

data.text: @nasersanjar1 1_sched_priorauth_status may be more fitting and placing it in the Scheduling folder should be fine.
@nasersanjar1 What is the latest on this?

Report must include all inpatients 65 and older OR all inpatients who are Senior Wise members (there needs to be a field in the report indicating they're a Senior Wise member; it will be blank for that who aren't). Senior Wise members are being tracked via PowerForms. So it's encounter-level but needs to be treated as patient-level since any subsequent encounters won't contain the Senior Wise PowerPlan.

a report that displays physician activity.  It is generated once for every new physician after they have been at CHH at least 3 months. 

So That:
I can have that data readily available for reappointment, focused professional proactive evaluation,  and ongoing professional practice

Requester: Gina Jeffers

Creation of Safety Report for Utilization Review that will run daily and report any admitted patient without a utilization review performed within 36 hours of the time of the admit. Completed utilization reviews are given an encounter clinical review ID, therefore any patient without this number existing in Cerner that is an admitted patient (Inpatient/Observation) will appear on this report. The report needs to contain the following information: patient name FIN Location Payer admission date discharge date patient status. Utilization review is process for obtain financial authorization and payment from the patient's insurance provider. Submission for this authorization and payment must be submitted timely. This report will make sure the UR team is not missing submission of timely reviews. Also with the current Cerner Model there is only a manual process for notification of new insurance providers to the UR team. If a patient provides our registration with a new payer (insurance) and registration enters the new insurance information into Cerner, the register will have to email the UR team of the new provider so that this provider and be added to the a UR team worklist- this is manual process leaving room for errors. Creation of this report will identify new unassigned payers in the case of the manual process falling apart. Unknown work effort. Needs completed before Go-Live.
Sent an email to Valerie and Denise to test the report.

listing.description:
Bring perspective to due dates with the Calendar Power-Up for Trello. Whether you are planning a conference, managing an editorial calendar, or organizing a family vacation, the Calendar Power-Up let’s you display cards with due dates in a weekly or monthly calendar view. Easily prioritize cards by dragging and dropping them on the calendar to automatically update their due dates, and export your Trello calendar to third party apps with an iCalendar link.

- Display and filter cards with due dates in a weekly or monthly calendar view.

- Manage due dates by dragging and dropping cards on the calendar.

- Easily see completed tasks by marking due dates complete.

- Export a board’s calendar to third party calendars with each board’s unique iCalendar link.

- The Calendar Power-Up is supported on the web and iOS and Android mobile devices.

cards.desc:
DA2 Report Alias: OPIN Charge & Free Drug Admins
CCL Program Name: n/a
Built With Application: Powerinsight
Distribution: Powerinsight
Run adhoc? yes/monthly scheduled refresh
Estimated Hours to Build:40

**Contact:**
[Amy Schultz](amy.schultz@chhi.org)

**Recommendation:**
I would also like to track the white bagging practices in the OPIN for the following medications: Prolia, Fasenra, Remicade, Ocrevus, IVIG, Tysabri, Nucala. I need to pull how many of these drugs were administered on a monthly basis in the OPIN (charted occurrences) and then of the charted occurrences, how many where white bagged (AKA, no pharmacy charge to CHH) So of X number of ocrevus, tysabri, etc infused this month, Y were free drug. Would also like it to report out: date of administration, drug name, dose, frequency, ordering provider, and insurance carrier. Need to track monthly.

**Justification:**
Emerging changes to medication benefit design are designed to drive patients from the medical benefit to the pharmacy benefit. In a number of these plans, specialty pharmaceuticals are restricted to preferred network pharmacies. If the health system does not have a specialty pharmacy within the payer network, the patient is forced to use the plans own specialty pharmacy OR the preferred pharmacy. this creates a white bagging scenario when the patient wants to have the medication administered in the OPIN here at CHH. White bagging refers to a specialty pharmaceutical being shipped by an off site pharmacy to CHH pharmacy where we administer it in the OPIN. Therefore CHH pharmacy does not purchase the drug or collect the revenue. I would like to be able to track this month to month, to make sure revenue is not slipping out of network unnoticed as the number of white bagging patients is projected to increase by national projections
cards.name: [11587] OPIN White Bagging
